item.title: Frame
item.description: In the context of computing, a frame is a single image displayed by a monitor. By displaying a series of frames in rapid succession, the illusion of a motion can be conveyed on a monitor.

item.title: Game Loop
item.description: The Game Loop defines the individual steps a [[Game Engine|game engine]] executes in order to produce a working game. There are three main steps that repeat as the game runs.

item.title: Game Physics
item.description: Movement Speed The rate of change of position over a fixed time-step in any direction. Speed = Distance / Time

item.title: Scalar
item.description: A Scalar has [[GameDev/magnitude|magnitude]]. As opposed to a [[GameDev/Vector|Vector]], scalars only indicate a size, without direction. Scalars can be used to “scale” vectors, thereby changing it’s magnitude without changing it’s the angle of its direction.

item.title: Vector
item.description: A vector has [[GameDev/magnitude|magnitude]] and direction. In a 2D plane, this can be represented by a coordinate points. Mathematic notation uses bold to indicate a vector and vertical bars to represent ||magnitude|| of a vector.
